title: Polygon.io
textParagraphs: Polygon.io is a web game created as part of the "Advanced Software Engineering" course at Ã‰cole des Mines de Nancy.
The aim of this project was to create a web application using api. We chose to create a multi-player web game, inspired by the style of the game

In this game, players embody polygons and must shoot down other players to gain experience and evolve into a larger polygon. (An n-sided polygon can shoot n projectiles.) Players can also collect experience bubbles on the map or life bubbles to heal themselves. A gauge representing the number of bullets in their magazine is also present. Finally, a player ranking, a minimap and a text chat are displayed in real time.
The source code for this project is available on
The game is no longer deployed so as not to incur hosting costs.

midRows.title: Using Nextjs
midRows.content: Next.js is an open-source JavaScript framework for building server-side and client-side web applications. The server is in Node.js and the client in React.

midRows.title: Graphic elements
midRows.content: Pixi.js is a JavaScript library for fast, fluid 2D rendering. We used it for all the graphics in the game, including the user interface, polygons, balls and bubbles.

midRows.title: Redis database
midRows.content: We used Redis to store player data (position, experience, etc.) as well as ball and bubble locations on the pitch. Redis enables data to be accessed in a matter of microseconds, which is perfect for a real-time game.
